definition: municipality, namely: Beijing 北京, Tianjin 天津, Shanghai 上海 and Chongqing 重慶|重庆, the first level administrative subdivision/province level city/also called directly governed city
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to govern/to control/having jurisdiction over/linchpin of a wheel (archaic)/noise of a barrow
municipality, namely: Beijing 北京, Tianjin 天津, Shanghai 上海 and Chongqing 重慶|重庆, the first level administrative subdivision/province level city/also called directly governed city

sentences.english: Brossard is the most ethnically diverse municipality in Quebec.
sentences.chinese: 寶沙是魁北克種族最多樣化的直轄市。

sentences.english: Tianjin is one of the four municipalities in China.
sentences.chinese: 天津是中國的四個直轄市之一。

sentences.english: Municipalities, and other urban authorities are now investing in tree growing as well.
sentences.chinese: 直轄市和其他城市當局正在着力樹生長的。

sentences.english: In China's sometimes confusing administrative nomenclature, Chongqing is called a municipality, one of only four that enjoy provincial-level status (the others are Beijing, Shanghai and Tianjin).
sentences.chinese: 用中國令人困惑的行政術語來說，重慶是直轄市。

definition: autonomous region, namely: Inner Mongolia 內蒙古自治區|内蒙古自治区, Guangxi 廣西壯族自治區|广西壮族自治区, Tibet 西藏自治區|西藏自治区, Ningxia 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区, Xinjiang 新疆維吾爾自治區|新疆维吾尔自治区
Xinzhu or Hsinchu County in northwest Taiwan
Yangtze River Delta/abbr. for 長江三角洲|长江三角洲
